name: hexjumper
text: It's really easy to miss, what with the picture of the guy getting his teeth knocked out dominating the frame, but if you look towards the bottom of the panel, somebody's engaging in Full Moon Kung Fu.

name: aparrish
text: In the Great Outdoor Fight, you must use every asset available to you.

name: direhaggis
text: That also seems to include a dude with what looks like a hairbrush to the right of the ass-ets guy.

name: eneella
text: it's a boot.

name: ravindra108
text: No, further right.

name: paco
text: speaking of that, what's with the dude with the pipe? Are weapons allowed in the GOF, and if so, why doesn't everyone use them?

name: lucidloon
text: Perhaps found in the yard?

name: jaldor
text: According to the rules , the contestants have been allowed to use any object found on the Acres since 1932. So it must have been carelessly left on the premises, because I really can't fathom how a man could smuggle a four foot long lead pipe in without being noticed.

name: jaldor
text: Wait, sir, asses, assets, assestbar... I think you just made a  double-meta-pun! Somebody promote this man.

name: baryonyx
text: Also, that the teeth are being knocked out by a disembodied arm.

name: mustakrakesh
text: I'm proud to be this comments 101st chubby!

name: dersquirrel
text: What's even better is that it couldn't have been spontaneous.  That guy's been right outside the entire time thinking "I'm going to go up to the first guy I see and moon the fuck out of him."

name: methadone
text: yeah that's outta the blue

name: delzhand
text: And then there's the graphic depiction of a kick right inbetween the nuts.

name: luckypyjamas
text: hard enough to knock the dude's pants off

name: yingkaixing
text: More of a stomp

name: straw
text: If my backyard at 5 this morning is any indication cats really fucking love fighting outdoors and in large groups

name: woodenteeth
text: Although I think perhaps the noises you're hearing aren't ALL fighting noises. This puts a different spin on what might go on at the GOF.

name: thedudeabides85
text: The prospect of buying several cats, and forcing them to watch Van Damme films until they conduct an annual fighting tournament leaves a sliver of hope in my otherwise gray, meagerly apportioned life on this Earth.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, riotdejaneiro, salo, jollysaintpete, Baryonyx, Direhaggis, Doc_Rostov, yingkaixing, Panserbjorne, Satyr)

name: senseihollywood
text: the bald guy on the left side is receiving the James Tiberius Kirk Double Fist to the top of the head

name: soticoto
text: Shatnered Skull.

name: kochipoik
text: commonly called a "hardboiled egg" in my primary school. Hurt much more than the "soft-boiled egg" but wasn't quite as realistic.

name: goocifer
text: and according to the alt-text, most of these guys are from circumstances

name: morypcaina
text: didn't Roast Beef think three dollars was a good price for wine during his date with Molly?

name: feetnotes
text: Beef knows that only a fool gets into the opening-minutes fight just inside the door. It is completely for amateurs.

name: senseihollywood
text:
Well, of course...he learned it from Rodney...

[IMGS OFF]

name: dasilodavi
text: The fighting is good, but watching Beef intellectualize his way through the fight is what really juices me up!

name: luckypyjamas
text: so you'll notice, all the people getting the shit beat out of them have moustaches

name: saint
text:
..just like in real life?

This means someone needs to hand the frontman for Weezer his own ass.


please.

name: farqussus
text: Beef is assertive.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i would be to if the only way to escape death was in a corner of a place.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
wow.

fail.

TOO.

name: professorhazard
text: That sure looks like Perfect Ron Sipes getting his teeth knocked out.

name: mshendry
text: cat fight?

name: wulvaine
text: This is probably just a strange product of my youth, but that shutter that acts as a door to the Acres reminds me a bit of the old school Mega Man games. The ones on the NES, before Capcom ruined the series by trying to give it a storyline.

name: phthoggos
text: I hate to be "that guy," but you were four years old when the last NES Mega Man game came out.

name: wulvaine
text: I know. I played them from the time I was 3, though. Mega Man 3 was the first video game I ever played. I sucked at it for a couple years more, but the NES ones are still way better than the crap Capcom pumps out now.

name: snowman
text: This reminds me of when people are surprised I know old Beatles and Dylan songs. They were recorded.

name: tbtabby
text: It had a storyline from the beginning, actually.

name: wulvaine
text: Yes, it did, so I guess I worded that poorly. The story in the NES games was pretty thin, it must be said, but it was present, and it worked. The series was fine up until about Mega Man X4, and then it all went to hell.

name: unsentletter
text:
Although no-one is jumping onto the door as it opens so that it pulls them through onto the next screen.

Mega Man II = <3

name: fermatprime
text:
Re-reading this arc with the assetbar commentary.

Looking at the last panel of this one, I thought to myself "Damn, I bet a lot of the Fighters end up getting D/Q'ed in the first few hours." Then I read Panel 2 of the next strip...

Onstad, you magnificent bastard.

name: riotdejaneiro
text: I am there. And the other 2999 players are there. And it´s just the 3000 of us. And I put the other players´ body in my van. And I am the winner

name: darqhermit
text: three dollars IS a good price for wine, dammit. Don't judge me.

name: jamb23
text:
Directly below the WHACK: a distant relative of Lyle's?

I'll be honest, you have to want it.

name: brailleteeth
text: GOF could be a dope film in the same vein as Battle Royale.
